revised_title: Anatomical Examination of a Sudden Death Case
tldr: Dr. Charles Preston and Monsieur Du Linier perform an autopsy on a nine-year-old boy who died suddenly from vomiting. They discover a polypus in the boy's heart and brain, as well as an inflamed pleura and a distended bladder. The cause of the boy's vomiting and death is conjectured to be related to these findings.
